title: “Let’s embrace and respect South Africa’s diversity”
text:
In his first month in office, former president Nelson Mandela proclaimed: “Each of us is as intimately attached to the soil of this beautiful country as are the famous Jacaranda trees in Pretoria and the Mimosa trees of the Bushveld – a rainbow nation at peace with itself and the world”
September is Heritage Month let us embrace, respect and celebrate our countries diversity.
It is so yesterday to her people hurling insults, mocking and ridiculing each other because they are of different races or speak different languages.
The fact that we are different colours or speak different languages, should not give us the wrong idea that we are not one.
Our different races, cultures, languages, and traditions combiner to beautify our country just like flowers with different colours in a flower garden.
Racial and cultural tolerance will surely take us backwards. Let us all learn to be like crayons: although they are of different colours, they peacefully stay in the same box.
At the end of the day, we are all created in the image of God, so let us embrace and respect each other’s diversity in this month of Heritage.
